sub_title: Director of Health OnePlanet at Radboud University Nijmegen
summary:
Experience: Bio-Physical Chemistry, Life Sciences, experience in biochemistry and crystallization, biomolecules and protein bio functionality, diagnostics, screening, drug development, nanotechnology.
Experience in innovation strategies and valorization, business development in early stages and primary growth stages.
Current Goals: public private partnerships in innovation, knowledge intensive organisations and businesses, turn around strategies,  Business Development and Platform building. 
Primary Goal: Building multi-stakeholder partnerships and innovation platforms, public private projects and partnerships, business development, growth and change.  Strategy building, Positioning, Network and relation building,Growth by business and portfolio development

Specialties: public private partnerships, change/ growth strategies in organisations of professionals, network building, business development, innovation strategies
business and portfolio development, generating motivation, energy, empowerment,

projects.title: COILED
projects.description: COILED: Center for Open Innovation in Lead Discovery is a public private Innovation Centre for lead discovery and the early development of lead and drug candidates. With the combination of available and unique targets, biological assays, screening facilities and  of the Pivot Park, compound libraries, medicinal chemistry and disease models of Radboud University Medical Center, COILED creates a unique platform for early drug development. The EFRO grant supplies us with a kick-start of the new development centre located in the Nijmegen area with shareholders both in Nijmegen and Oss.

projects.title: COPD+
projects.description: COPD+ is a public private consortium aiming to develop tools like the smart care assistant for patients / people suffering from COPD. The smart care assistant is a ehealth module and app, existing of a unique patented and validated Baysian model, that can predict exacerbations of COPD-patients, without seeing a health professional. The cloud-based ICT architecture shall lead to an interactive approach, e-coaching of the patient for personalized interventions and patient centered treatments, a reduction of hospitalization and complications and a methodology that can be further developed for a number of chronic diseases.

projects.title: BES: Betuwse Energie Samenwerking
projects.description: BES is a public private partnership to optimize the sustainable energy production, use and storage in regional areas. Starting in the region of West-Betuwe we will develop a sustainable year- and day-round balancing system to optimize the self-management of regional  sustainable energy supply. As a business partner we created a new support and service company EDBR (Energy Diensten Bedrijf Rivierenland), to balance and optimize the energy production, use and storage at different levels in the energy system (households, street or district, regional, national levels). Technology and infrastructure assets will be combined in a new governance approach to yield supportive tools and services for both consumers as well as business partners.

projects.title: Charge & Go
projects.description: Charge & Go is a public private consortium to support the e-mobility both on a regional, national and international level. Charge & Go partners facilitate choices concerning finding, offering and using charging infrastructure for Electrical Transport via a open source and accessible charging platform. This platform offers smart charging infrastructure: charging plazas, where an efficient use of charging power is steered to optimize a multi-user demand, interactive charging apps, the Parkagent infrastructure Optimization Tool: supporting consumers in finding charging options and business partners in optimizing both location and exploitation of charging infrastructure AND the Motown open source data platform and communication apps with services for reservation, charging and payment of charging and accompanying services.

projects.title: Proeftuin Zorg van de Toekomst, pilot integrated care@home
projects.description: In the "Proeftuin Zorg van de Toekomst" / pilot integrated care we try to offer integrated high quality care at home. A number of 100 patients in two communities in Nijmegen are offered helping aids, tools and a communication platform to receive all the best care at their own homes. We create a community of GP's, nurses, doctors and specialists, who, together with the home carers, share information and help high quality care, without going to a hospital. With technical support tools, wearable sensors to monitor continuous health, sharing information with a user friendly and safe communication platform, we try to organize integrated care in the best possible ways, over the boundaries of first- third health care organisations and we will try to prove the cost efficiency of real outcome based care. Project partners are ParkinsonNet, Topicus Zorg, ZorgInvest en De PraktijkIndex. The project is supported by EFRO and the program OP-Oost

projects.title: BriteN
projects.description:
BriteN: Early nutritional Interventions for healthy brain development
BriteN is aimed at developing products for early interventions towards a healthy cognitive and metabolic development of young children. The partners of BriteN work together to reduce the risk of the development of  metabolic syndrom and obesity. BriteN develops a series of products: a  biomarker toolkit, to evaluate the efficacy of nutritional interventions, a translational Technology platform to study and monitor cognitive and metabolic development in animals, children and adults, intelligent and functional home cages and effective monitoring tasks, serious games and experience sampling to monitor the early development of spatial cognitive performance. With all these products we hope to get a better (mechanistic) understanding of the potential and functionality of nutritional ingredients and diets with respect to cognitive and metabolic development.

projects.title: Robuust En Co
projects.description: Robuust En Co is a partnership of 7 front runner energy cooperations in the province of Gelderland. With this network they have launched a new association: VECG: Vereniging Energie Cooperaties Gelderland. With the 7 cooperative energy organisations in Robuust En Co, we try to further co-develop 12 business cases of Sustainable Energy and Services towards a robust business model. All the generated business models will be distributed amongst all members in Gelderland to create a new network organisation in sustainable energy and support the sustainable entrepreneurship and economic viability of sustainable energy in the region. The project is supported with a EFRO OP- Oost subsidy.

projects.title: HIPERSENSE
projects.description: HIPERSENSE is a private - public driven innovation, leading to a combined and integrated system for high-end data processing with integrated off grid (stand-alone) sustainable and tunable energy supply . This provides a stable, robust and flexible solution for continuous high end dataprocessing systems in remote areas without stable and robust power infrastructure. It may however also serve as a fall back solution in dense populated areas, where the energy net is not fully equipped for heavy peaks in the energy demand as a result of demanding data-processing, or where crucial functions need to secured with a flexible back up system.  First launching customer is the Blackgem project in Chili for the dataprocessing and power system of the telescopes to be build in the area, other applications may be the medical urgency hospitals, defence systems or fall back systems in risk of flood areas.

projects.title: FlowPlast
projects.description: FlowPlast is a public private cooperation aimed at the development of a series of hydrogels for wound dressing applications, tailored for active intervention in the different stages of wound repair. FlowPlasts offers a unique tunable biomechanical hydrogel, to be sprayed on  a wound and acting not only covering the wound, but also controlling and facilitating cell growth and cell repair.  It will be optimized in its functionality in tissue regeneration and repair, and validated in its biomimetic activity. FlowPlast is foreseen as a new generation of  active wound dressing for clinical use in burns and ulcer wounds.

contributors.headline: Director of Health OnePlanet at Radboud University Nijmegen

projects.title: ParkinsonNeXt
projects.description: ParkinsonNeXt is a public private project and partnership trying to improve the self-management and selfcare of patients suffering from Parkinson Disease. A series of selfmanagement products is developed to support patients to live at home for a longer period of time with an improved quality of life and to empower patients in creating their own treatment plans together with their physicians, home carers and family. Products that are developed are a self care portal with personalized health and diagnostic data and treatment plans + advices, a medicin cabinet with feed back system and personalized apps, physical trainers with applied games and virtual reality in combination with health monitoring feed back and applied games to stimulate cognitive health, again with personalized feed back. With this set of support we aim  to create a platform where the quality of care and health impact is monitored. This can lead to a optimized treatment plan, with high impact on health treatment to be insured.  Overall, the project aims to reduce health care costs by optimizing between several health care treatments and products and avoiding hospitalization. ParkinsonNeXt  has the support of several insurance companies and is created out of the Foundation ParkinsonNet. The project is created with the financial support of GO-EFRO.

projects.title: Time to Image
projects.description: Time to Image is a public private project aiming to optimize the pre-screening of lead compounds or drug candidates by enabling the imaging of the compounds and their transport and delivery, functioning and efficacy. In the technology development we combine and develop new chemical routes for chemical synthesis, radiolabeling and imaging techniques. By combination technology we aim to reduce the pre-screening by several orders of magnitude towards a few weeks. By reducing the number of probable candidates from a few thousand to a number of 10 - 100, we can reduce the cost of screening and drug development. The project is supported by GO-EFRO.

projects.title: RichWaterWorld
projects.description: Rich Water World is an innovative public private partnership demonstration project, aiming at generating a sustainable water and energy region, with both social, environmental and economic impact. The project anticipates on climate change, making use of extremes in water quantities in the region, developing a dynamic hydrology system, purifying the surface water in an ecological bio-cascade, winning back nutriënts like phosphate and using the biomass for local energy producten and local distribution and use.

contributors.headline: Director of Health OnePlanet at Radboud University Nijmegen

projects.title: FOCOM: FOod COgnition Model Systems
projects.description: FOCOM is an innovative project combining Food and Health expertises. FOCOM is concerned with developing model systems, based on gut-brain interaction and mechanisms, evaluating and forecasting eating behaviour and choice, reward mechanisms involved with eating or anticipating eating and buying behaviour with relevant mechanisms involved. FOCOM generates insights in these mechanisms and translates these to relevant input and output parameters, to be measured, yielding objective evaluation and insights in eating behaviour and factors of liking. Also, FOCOM will realize a more objective cognition test, to be used in evaluation healthy ageing or cognitive impairment and degeneration. FOCOM is realized with the financial support of GO EFRO

projects.title: UltraSense NMR
projects.description: UltraSense NMR is a innovative programme, developing high sensitivity and high resolution NMR methodology and equipment for diagnostic analysis and screening and for the use in diagnostic tests. Basis of the innovative development is the use of hyperpolarization techniques, either by DNP or pH2 hydrogenation (PHIP). Aim of the project is generating new prototype products for industrial and medical / diagnostic use.

profile_positions.description: IMEC, Wageningen University & Research and Radboud University and Medical Center invest in the development of 'OnePlanet Research Center', a new  Innovation Center (spring 2019) for nano-electronics and smart sensoring in Food and Health. We aim to develop new leading edge solutions for tailored and personalized Health care, personalized diets and nutrients, Citizen empowerment and self management, a better quality of life and Health care at home or nearby, and precision farming, food processing and tailored supply chains. IMEC provides the technology to make these innovations work. In an open innovation approach, we will work together with SME's and Regional Education Centers at all levels to educate the new and current generation of  professionals with all new digital technology available, contributing to the labor market in the region.
